icoh.title: ICOH
icoh.firsttext: The International Commission on Occupational Health (ICOH) is an international non-governmental professional society dedicated to promoting scientific progress, knowledge and the development of occupational health and safety.
icoh.thirdtext: Today it has more than 2,000 members from over 110 countries, being a world leader in occupational health
icoh.fourthtext: Recognized by the United Nations as an NGO, it collaborates closely with the ILO and the WHO.

Scom.title: SCOM
Scom.firsttext: The Scientific Committee on Occupational Medicine (SCOM) of the ICOH is one of the oldest in the organization, with more than 120 members from nearly 45 countries.
Scom.secondtext: Occupational Medicine is a medical specialty that addresses health risks in the workplace, including prevention, diagnosis, treatment and rehabilitation of work-related diseases.

Secre_Scom.title: ICOH National Secretariat for Peru
Secre_Scom.firsttext: ICOH has National Secretaries (NS) in countries on all continents in the world. NSs represent ICOH and its activities in the country and region where they have been appointed and promote cooperation and communication between ICOH members in their country and region. information.title: 3rd Conference of the Scientific Committee on Occupational Medicine
information.subtitle: The Future and Opportunities for Occupational Medicine
information.firsttext: The event is organized by the Peruvian National Secretariat of the International Commission on Occupational Health (ICOH) in collaboration with the Scientific Committee on Occupational Medicine (SCOM).
information.secondtext: The objective of this event is to promote the update on emerging occupational diseases, their impact on the population and prevention strategies, adopting a comprehensive approach that addresses medical, management and legal perspectives.
information.thirdtext: The event is aimed at occupational physicians and occupational safety and health (OSH) professionals from Peru, neighboring countries and other regions of the world. Since its announcement at the 34th ICOH Congress in Marrakech, Morocco, it has generated great international interest.
information.fourthtext: This conference will be held on
information.place: The University of Piura, Lima Campus, Lima, Peru.

topics.text: The main thematic axes of this event will be the following:
topics.first: Diagnosis and approach to occupational diseases
topics.seventh: Mental health and its work-related disorders
topics.tenth: Ergonomics and OHS at the workplace

Characters.subtitle: Meet the key members who make this event possible. Each of them brings experience, dedication, and passion.

firstFoundling.name: Dr. Gogillan Sevaratnam
firstFoundling.description: Occupational Physician and Master in Public Health, currently serving as Vice President of the Malaysian Society of Occupational Health since 2018 and Chair of the ICOH Scientific Committee on Occupational Medicine. He is an active member of the ICOH Task Force for Process and Practice Modernization for the 2024-2027 period. Additionally, he serves as a guest lecturer at NIOSH Malaysia and the Department of Occupational Medicine at Kathmandu Medical College, Nepal.
firstFoundling.description2: With a deep interest and passion for occupational cancer, he has actively participated in numerous programs to raise awareness and visibility of this issue among employers and workers in his country.

secondFoundling.name: Dr. Norvil Mera Chu
secondFoundling.description: Occupational Physician with a Master's in Occupational and Environmental Medicine, and a PhD candidate in Medicine. He has extensive experience as an occupational health consultant and medical surveillance advisor in companies across various sectors, as well as a lecturer in undergraduate and postgraduate programs. He is also recognized for his work as a researcher and speaker at academic events.
secondFoundling.description2: He has served on the Board of Directors of the Peruvian Society of Occupational Health and actively participates in ICOH Scientific Committees, including Occupational Health Epidemiology (EPICOH), Occupational Health for Small Enterprises and the Informal Sector (SCOHSSEIS), and Education and Training in Occupational Health (SCETOH). He is currently the National Secretary of ICOH for Peru.

thirdFoundling.name: Dr. Miriam Panduro
thirdFoundling.description: Occupational Physician with a Master's in Occupational and Environmental Health, Medical Auditor, with 14 years of experience in occupational health management and medical services. Experience in the Clinical and Assistance Sector; Health Management in industries such as Fishing, Hydrocarbons, Metal Mechanics, Construction, Transportation, Road Concessions, and Services; Implementation and Lead Auditor of Integrated Management Systems under ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001 standards.
thirdFoundling.description2: Member of the International Commission on Occupational Health (ICOH). Member of the ICOH Scientific Committee on Occupational Medicine (SCOM). Certified Occupational Hearing Conservationist by CAOHC (The Council for Accreditation in Occupational Hearing Conservation). Member of the Peruvian Society of Occupational Health (SOPESO).

first.name: Gogillan Sevaratnam
first.descripcion: Physician specialized in Public Health and Occupational Medicine, with extensive leadership and teaching experience at the international level. second.name: Norvil Mera Chu

third.name: Dr. Denis Barnaby

Active member of ICOH, ACOEM, ATS, SOPESO, and SOMOMA, with international certifications in safety, industrial hygiene, spirometry, and audiometry. He has participated in global occupational health congresses and is a guest lecturer at various Peruvian universities. Currently, he serves as Sub-Regional Medical Director and Medical Technology Leader at P&G for Latin America.

fourth.name: Dr. Aquiles Monroy

He has participated in ICOH congresses and meetings, including a presentation at the ICOH 2022 World Congress.

second.name: Dr. Jate Ratanachina
second.descripcion: Dr. Jate Ratanachina is an assistant professor and consultant occupational physician at the Department of Preventive and Social Medicine, Chulalongkorn Medical School in Bangkok, Thailand and an Honorary Research Associate at the National Heart and Lung Institute, Imperial College London in the UK. He studied for his Doctor of Medicine at Chulalongkorn University. He has a PhD in Clinical Medicine Research from Imperial College London. His research has been in the fields of Occupation & Environmental Epidemiology, Workplace Health Promotion, Preventive Medicine and Global Health.

third.name: Dr. Loubna Tahri
third.descripcion: Associate Professor of Occupational Medicine at Hassan II University, Casablanca, and occupational health physician at SUEZ ‚Äì Recycling and Waste Recovery. She was the president of the logistics committee, member of the scientific and organizing committee of the ICOH 2024 Congress in Morocco. She has worked as an occupational health physician at Four Seasons Hotel and other companies, with extensive experience in occupational health.

fourth.name: Dr. Bala Murali Sundram
fourth.descripcion: Senior Lecturer in Occupational and Environmental Health at the University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur, and an occupational health physician. Public Health specialist with expertise in epidemiology, disease surveillance, mental health and psychosocial biomarkers at work. He has held key roles in the Malaysian Ministry of Health before joining academia.

third.descripcion: Lawyer from the University of Lima, with a Master's degree in Occupational Safety and Health from the University of Turin (ILO) and in Labor Relations and Human Capital Management from the PUCP. Specialist in Labor Law and Public Policies. Founding partner of LABORA&ASOCIADOS SAC and Director of the Specialization Program in Safety, Health and Well-being at the UPC. Professor at the University of Lima and the Universidad El Bosque (Colombia).
